data.text: @sridd85 Yeah, I saw that narrative too, on some of the MSM propaganda networks and the corporate “fact checkers” sites. But I prefer to follow the money and check connections before trusting the official narratives.

@LeaAnnD17 The labs were already there. They are Soviet-era. Ukraine now “owns” the labs and operates them. The US provides experts to work in the Ukraine-based labs. They are not US built or operated. 
Similar to how US experts in oil & gas drilling are brought in by the Russians
@LeaAnnD17 scribd. LMAO even more. The fact that you think either one of those are actual sources is just insane. But hey you do you
@ntnlparkranger Facts don’t care about your feelings. Or the feelings of your 1 follower. 🤡
@GOPDepression You can’t prove it didn’t. 🤡 https://t.co/pZU4W5bYi5

@LeaAnnD17 U did. It’s thousands of words. Not gonna read thru all of it to find one sentence in a throw away paragraph that suggestively hints at a conspiracy. 
I’m asking exactly where I should look so I can read the relevant info that would persuade  me to  agree with that position
@LeaAnnD17 I understand ur point. No matter where u source ur information. Please. Conside this https://t.co/p0e6uB1LLa
@sridd85 The whole point is — some people are lying and denying the existence of the U.S. bio labs in Ukraine. They exist and they are definitely a huge cause for concern.
